    • Combining Repertoire with Expression with SingleCellExperiment

data.frame-like mutation/accessor generics for ContigCellDB objects

Source: R/ContigCellDB-methods.R
sub-sub-ContigCellDB-character-missing-method.Rd

A ContigCellDB pretend to be a cell_tbl data.frame in several regards. This is to enable nesting ContigCellDB objects in the colData of a SingleCellExperiment and so that various plotting functionality in scater can do something sensible.

# S4 method for ContigCellDB,character,missing
[[(x, i, j, ...)

# S4 method for ContigCellDB,ANY,missing,ANY
[(x, i, j, ..., drop = TRUE)

# S4 method for ContigCellDB
dim(x)

# S4 method for ContigCellDB
dimnames(x)

# S4 method for ContigCellDB
nrow(x)

# S4 method for ContigCellDB
ncol(x)

Arguments

x

ContigCellDB
i

integer or character index
j

ignored
...

ignored
drop

ignored

Value

See details.

Details

If x a ContigCellDB, then dim(x) and dimnames(x) return dim(x$cell_tbl) and dimnames(x$cell_tbl), respectively, and x[[col]] returns x$cell_tbl[[col]]. Likewise indexing with x[i,] returns cells indexed by i. Finally as.data.frame(x) returns x$cell_tbl.

Examples

 data(ccdb_ex)
 ccdb_ex[1:10,]

#> ContigCellDB of 17 contigs; 10 cells; and 0 clusters.
#> Contigs keyed by pop, sample, barcode, contig_id; cells keyed by pop, sample, barcode.
 head(ccdb_ex[['barcode']])

#> [1] "AAAGTAGTCGCGCCAA-1" "AACCATGCATTTGCCC-1" "AACTGGTGTCTGATCA-1"
#> [4] "AAGCCGCAGTAAGTAC-1" "AAGTCTGGTTCAACCA-1" "ACACCAAAGTCCAGGA-1"
 dim(ccdb_ex)

#> [1] 832   3
 dimnames(ccdb_ex)
